We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The mixed dense interstitial lymphocytic infiltrates in the portal triad suggest acute cellular rejection. CD8+ T lymphocytes react against donor MHCs in acute cellular rejection. CD4+ T lymphocytes reacting against recipient APCs cause acute humoral rejection. Pre-existing recipient antibodies cause hyperacute rejection. Grafted T lymphocytes reacting against host cause graft-versus-host disease, which is not applicable in this case as it occurs in hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.
